headline: Stocks to Watch Friday: Intel, Ford, Booz Allen Hamilton
summary: ? Intel (INTC): The chip maker reported sales growth in its core product line of PC processors and shrinking costs. Shares pared gains and ended the day up 0.3%. ↗️ Ford Motor (F): Strong sales propelled the automaker's revenue and operating income well past Wall Street estimates.

headline: Newmont Announces Commercial Production at Ahafo North in Ghana
summary: DENVER, October 24, 2025--Newmont Corporation (NYSE: NEM, ASX: NEM, PNGX: NEM) ("Newmont" or "the Company") today announced that its Ahafo North project in Afrisipakrom, Ghana has achieved commercial production, marking the successful completion of one of West Africa's most significant recent mining developments.

headline: Eli Lilly to buy Adverum, General Dynamics stock hits new record
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Eli Lilly's (LLY) deal to acquire Adverum Biotechnologies (ADVM), gold miner Newmont's (NEM) cost-cutting initiatives, and General Dynamics (GD) shares moving to an all-time record high following its latest earnings results fueled by jet demand. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Newmont Posts Earnings Beat Despite Gold’s Volatility. The Stock Falls Anyway.
summary: Gold miner  Newmont  reported better-than-expected quarterly profit and revenue, as well as “meaningful” improvement in the cost metrics around its full-year outlook, despite high expectations amid volatile gold prices.  Newmont’s average realized gold price was $3,539 per ounce in the third quarter, compared with $2,518 per ounce in the year-ago third-quarter.  It’s been a wilder ride since then: Spot gold prices rose to a record above $4,350 a troy ounce on Monday before tumbling on Tuesday and Wednesday.

raw.headline: Newmont Posts Earnings Beat Despite Gold’s Volatility. The Stock Falls Anyway.

It’s been a wilder ride since then: Spot gold prices rose to a record above $4,350 a troy ounce on Monday before tumbling on Tuesday and Wednesday.
